memberdef.argsstring: (const char *portName, const char *cameraSerial, int maxBuffers, size_t maxMemory, int priority, int stackSize, int maxFrames)
memberdef.name: andor3

briefdescription.para: Constructor for Andor3 driver; most parameters are simply passed to ADDriver::ADDriver.

detaileddescription.para: After calling the base class constructor this method creates a thread to collect the images from the detector and sets reasonable default values for the parameters defined in this class, asynNDArrayDriver, and ADDriver.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the asyn port driver to be created.
The serial number of the Andor camera.
The maximum number of NDArray buffers that the NDArrayPool for this driver is allowed to allocate. Set this to -1 to allow an unlimited number of buffers.
The maximum amount of memory that the NDArrayPool for this driver is allowed to allocate. Set this to -1 to allow an unlimited amount of memory.
The thread priority for the asyn port driver thread if ASYN_CANBLOCK is set in asynFlags.
The stack size for the asyn port driver thread if ASYN_CANBLOCK is set in asynFlags.
The number of frame buffers to use in driver.

detaileddescription.para:
pasynUser
asynUser structure that contains the function code in pasynUser->reason.
value
The value for this parameter
Takes action if the function code requires it. Currently only ADShutterControl requires action here. This method is normally called from the writeInt32 method in derived classes, which should set the value of the parameter in the parameter library.

memberdef.argsstring: (asynUser *pasynUser, char *strings[], int values[], int severities[], size_t nElements, size_t *nIn)
memberdef.name: readEnum

detaileddescription.para:
This method calls the report function in the asynPortDriver base class. It then calls the NDArrayPool::report() method if details >5.
fp
File pointed passed by caller where the output is written to.
details
If >5 then NDArrayPool::report and NDAttributeList::report are both called.

briefdescription.para: Driver for Andor sCMOS cameras using version 3 of their SDK; inherits from ADDriver class in ADCore.
